codersnacks_quiz.question: What is the difference between Javascript and Typescript?
codersnacks_quiz.response_valid: Typescript is a strict syntactical superset of JavaScript, and adds optional static typing to the language
codersnacks_quiz.response_invalid1: Typescript is a JS library to add custom font families
codersnacks_quiz.response_invalid2: ECMAScript 7 is called as the alias "Typescript"

codersnacks_category.description: Syntactical superset of JavaScript to adds optional static typing to Javascript
